text: Van Patrick (August 15, 1916 â€“ September 29, 1974) was an American sportscaster. He is best known for his play-by-play work with the Detroit Lions and Detroit Tigers.The Official Site of The Detroit Tigers: History: Tigers All-Time Broadcasters Patrick called Lions games from 1950 until his death in 1974 In addition he called play-by-play for the Cleveland Indians and MLB on Mutual. For football he called play-by-play for the NFL on Mutual and Notre Dame Fighting Irish football. He also called boxing for Mutual Radio. ==References== Category:1916 births Category:1974 deaths Category:Boxing broadcasters Category:College football broadcasters Category:National Football League broadcasters Category:Major League Baseball broadcasters
title: Van Patrick
